item.title: 欧盟政府面临对中国电动汽车关税的关键投票
item.description: 欧盟成员国将于周五就是否对进口中国产电动汽车征收最高达 45% 的关税进行关键性投票，这是该集团最受瞩目的贸易案件，有可能遭到中国政府的报复。【原文：European Union members face a pivotal vote on Friday on whether to impose tariffs of up to 45% on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles in the bloc's highest profile trade case, which risks retaliation from Beijing.】

item.title: 中东冲突引发石油上涨，但供应前景限制涨幅
item.description: 周五亚洲交易时段早盘，油价小幅上扬，保持了本周的强劲涨势，原因是投资者权衡了中东冲突和原油流动可能中断与全球市场供应充足之间的关系。【原文：Oil prices inched up in early Asian trading hours on Friday, holding on to their strong weekly gains, as investors weighed the Middle East conflict and the potential disruption in crude flows against an amply-supplied global market.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，在 Vestis 谈判期间，据说 Elis 将出价收购 UniFirst，但遭到拒绝
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，法国工作场所用品供应商 Elis SA 向美国同行 UniFirst 公司提出了非正式收购建议。【原文：French workplace supplies provider Elis SA made an informal takeover proposal to U.S. peer UniFirst Corp , Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 共和党顶级银行链桥银行在美国首次公开募股中融资 4100 万美元
item.description: Chain Bridge Bancorp 是一家自成立以来就深受共和党人欢迎的贷款机构，周四它在美国的首次公开募股定价为每股 22 美元，募集资金 4070 万美元。【原文：Chain Bridge Bancorp , a lender popular among Republicans since its inception, priced its U.S. initial public offering at $22 per share on Thursday to raise $40.7 million.】

item.title: 澳新银行支付 6800 万美元解决两起集体诉讼
item.description: 澳大利亚贷款机构澳新银行（ANZ）周五表示，该行将支付总计 9,900 万澳元（6,776 万美元）的赔偿金，以了结 2020 年对其提起的两起集体诉讼。【原文：Australian lender ANZ said on Friday it will pay a combined sum of A$99 million ($67.76 million) for the settlement of two class actions brought against it in 2020.】

item.title: 中国刺激政策吸引投资者重投陷入困境的房地产行业离岸债券
item.description: 一些中国和全球机构投资者正在重新审视中国的房地产债券，押注随着政府加快努力促进经济增长和重振陷入债务危机的房地产行业，中国房地产债券的前景将有所改善。【原文：Some Chinese and global institutional investors are revisiting Chinese property bonds, betting on an improvement in outlook as the government accelerates efforts to boost economic growth and revive a property sector in the throes of a debt crisis.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，思科将以 230 亿美元的估值投资 CoreWeave
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，思科系统公司将投资 CoreWeave，对这家云服务提供商的估值为 230 亿美元。【原文：Cisco Systems is set to invest in CoreWeave, valuing the cloud services provider at $23 billion, according to a Bloomberg News report on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 早间竞标石油阴影笼罩全球市场
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美国精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）正在与债券持有人就可能申请破产的条款进行谈判
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）正在与债券持有人就其与捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）合并失败后可能申请破产的条款进行谈判。【原文：Spirit Airlines is in talks with bondholders over terms of a potential bankruptcy filing in the wake of its failed merger with JetBlue Airways , the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚第三季度上游业务盈利下降
item.description: 埃克森美孚在周四提交的一份监管文件中表示，油价的变化将使该能源巨头第三季度的上游收益减少 6 亿至 10 亿美元。【原文：Exxon Mobil signaled in a regulatory filing on Thursday that changes in oil prices would reduce the energy major's third-quarter upstream earnings by $600 million to $1 billion.】

item.title: 2025 年，美国免费报税系统将扩展到 24 个州，纳税人将达到 3000 万
item.description: 美国财政部周四表示，24 个参与州的 3,000 多万纳税人明年将有资格通过国内税收署扩大的在线直接申报系统免费申报联邦税。【原文：The U.S. Treasury said on Thursday that more than 30 million taxpayers in 24 participating states will be eligible to file their federal taxes for free next year through the Internal Revenue Service's expanded online Direct File system.】

item.title: 美联储票据损失突破 2,000 亿美元大关
item.description: 根据美国联邦储备银行周四公布的数据，本周美国联邦储备银行的损失超过了 2,000 亿美元。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve losses crossed the $200 billion point this week, according to data released on Thursday by the central bank.】

item.title: 特朗普表示，如果他当选，将不允许任何州禁止汽油动力汽车
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，如果他在 11 月当选，任何州都不能禁止以汽油为动力的汽车或卡车。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Thursday that, if he is elected in November, no state will be able to ban gas-powered cars or trucks.】

item.title: 艾伯维因研发支出下调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: 艾伯维周四下调了对2024年调整后利润的预期，理由是8200万美元的里程碑以及与收购相关的研发费用。【原文：AbbVie on Thursday lowered its forecast for 2024 adjusted profit, citing $82 million in milestones, and research and development expenses related to acquisitions.】

item.title: 法国总理巴尼耶确认将为大型企业增税
item.description: 法国新任总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）周四在法国电视二台（France 2）的节目中表示，法国将提高对国内最大公司和最富有个人的企业税，这证实了此前的媒体报道。【原文：France's new prime minister, Michel Barnier, will increase corporate tax on the biggest companies in the country and on wealthiest individuals, he said on France 2 television on Thursday, confirming earlier media reports.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州总检察长起诉 TikTok 涉嫌共享儿童个人数据
item.description: 德克萨斯州总检察长肯-帕克斯顿（Ken Paxton）周四起诉 TikTok，指控该社交媒体平台在未经儿童父母或法定监护人同意的情况下共享儿童的个人身份信息，违反了州法律。【原文：TikTok has been sued by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton, who on Thursday accused the social media platform of violating state law by sharing children's personal identifying information without consent from their parents or legal guardians.】

item.title: 两名美国参议员就波音认罪协议批评司法部
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一封信，两位美国参议员批评了司法部 7 月份与波音公司达成的认罪协议，并表示政府应该对这家飞机制造商的高管采取行动，"让他们对安全失误负责"。【原文：Two U.S. senators criticized the Justice Department's plea deal with Boeing struck in July and said the government should take action against the planemaker's executives "responsible for safety failures," according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国东海岸港口货运量最高的零售商
item.description: 美国东海岸港口近五十年来最大规模的码头工人罢工已进入第三天，威胁到从香蕉到汽车零件等货物的短缺，并造成停泊在主要港口外的船只积压。【原文：The largest dockworker strike in nearly fifty years has entered its third day at U.S. East Coast ports, threatening shortages of goods ranging from bananas to auto parts and causing a backlog of ships anchored outside major ports.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，特斯拉计划以优质租约为支撑出售 8 亿美元债务
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，在业内类似资产担保证券激增的背景下，特斯拉正准备出售以其主要借款人的汽车租赁为担保的 7.83 亿美元债务。【原文：Tesla is preparing to sell $783 million in debt, backed by automotive leases from its prime borrowers amid a surge in similar asset-backed securities within the industry, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道西班牙呼吁在欧盟就电动汽车关税投票前与中国达成妥协
item.description: 在欧盟就电动汽车（EV）关税进行关键投票前夕，西班牙周四表示，欧盟应寻求与中国通过谈判达成妥协。【原文：The European Union should seek a compromise and negotiated outcome with China, Spain said on Thursday, on the eve of a crucial EU vote on electric vehicle (EV) tariffs.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比称码头工人罢工可能导致物价上涨
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四表示，零售商和制造商已经囤积了大约两周的商品，以应对美国码头工人罢工，但如果劳资纠纷持续下去，由此造成的供应链中断可能会导致价格上涨。 "古尔斯比告诉芝加哥公共广播电台："一开始只是带来不便，时间越长情况越糟。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee on Thursday said retailers and manufacturers had stockpiled about two weeks worth of items in anticipation of the U.S. dockworkers' strike, but the resulting supply-chain disruptions could lead to higher prices if the labor dispute persists. "It starts as an inconvenience and it gets worse the longer it goes," Goolsbee told Chicago public radio sta】

item.title: 得克萨斯州总检察长起诉胰岛素生产商和药房中间商成本过高
item.description: 得克萨斯州总检察长起诉了主要的胰岛素生产商和药房福利管理公司（PBM），指控他们合伙抬高胰岛素的成本。【原文：The Texas attorney general has sued leading insulin manufacturers and pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs), accusing them of collaborating to inflate the cost of insulin.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称德国将投票反对欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 知情人士周四告诉路透社，德国周五将投票反对欧盟对中国电动汽车征收关税。【原文：Germany on Friday will vote against the introduction of European Union tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, people with knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 萨瓦德尔首席执行官称 2024 年全年利润可达 16 亿欧元
item.description: 西班牙萨瓦德尔银行（Sabadell）首席执行官塞萨尔-冈萨雷斯-布埃诺（Cesar Gonzalez-Bueno）周四表示，如果该银行下半年的业绩能与上半年一样好，那么 2024 年的净利润将超过 16 亿欧元（17.6 亿美元）。【原文：The CEO of Spain's Sabadell , Cesar Gonzalez-Bueno, on Thursday said the bank could earn more than 1.6 billion euros ($1.76 billion) in net profit in 2024 if it manages to perform as well in the second half of the year as it did in the first.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）在早些时候失利后寻求就选举投注问题举行快速上诉听证会
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission）已要求联邦上诉法院加快审理一宗案件，以确定美国人是否可以合法地使用衍生品合约来押注美国大选的结果。【原文：The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission has asked a federal appeals court to expedite a hearing in a case that would determine if Americans can legally use derivatives contracts to bet on the outcomes of U.S. elections.】

item.title: 罢工仍在继续，美国零售商寻求备用运输计划，为假期做好准备
item.description: 随着美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸港口罢工的持续，从李维斯-施特劳斯（Levi Strauss）到好市多（Costco）等大型零售商都在准备替代运输计划，以确保货物能及时运抵假日旺季。【原文：Major retailers from Levi Strauss to Costco are preparing alternative shipping plans to ensure goods arrive in time for the peak holiday season as the U.S. East Coast and Gulf Coast ports strike drags on.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，在线零售商 Shein 即将在伦敦上市前举行路演
item.description: 三位知情人士透露，Shein 将在未来几周内为其伦敦首次公开募股（IPO）计划举行非正式投资者会议，在等待英国监管机构批准的同时推进准备工作。【原文：Shein is set to hold informal investor meetings in the coming weeks for its planned London initial public offering (IPO), three sources with knowledge of the matter said, pushing ahead with preparations as it awaits UK regulatory approval.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，特斯拉计划在 2026 年推出四款新电池，其中包括用于机器人出租车的电池
item.description: 据《信息报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，特斯拉计划设计四种新型内部电池，为其即将推出的机器人出租车 Cybertruck 和其他电动汽车提供动力。【原文：Tesla plans to design four new versions of its in-house battery to power the Cybertruck, its forthcoming robotaxi and other electric vehicles, the Information reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of its plans.】

item.title: 独家报道竞争对手浏览器称微软在 Edge 上的做法不公平，应遵守欧盟技术规则
item.description: 三款竞争对手浏览器和一批网络开发商在致欧盟委员会的一封信中说，微软的 Edge 网络浏览器具有不公平的优势，欧盟反垄断监管机构应该对其实施严厉的欧盟技术规则。【原文：Microsoft gives its Edge web browser an unfair advantage and EU antitrust regulators should subject it to tough EU tech rules, three rival browsers and a group of web developers said in a letter to the European Commission.】

item.title: 2024 年假日购物销售额预测
item.description: 美国零售商正在为今年比往年更短的假期购物窗口做准备，注重价格的购物者将重点放在 "黑色星期五 "和 "网络星期一 "等重要活动前后的优惠和促销活动上。【原文：U.S. retailers are gearing up for a shorter-than-usual holiday shopping window this year, with price-conscious shoppers focused on deals and promotions around key events such as Black Friday and Cyber Monday.】
